titleStmt.title: Henry Weindell to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG2222

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Appointments by the Governor, Civil Appointments, 1863-1867

body.p:
Office of Asst. Quartermaster
Louisville Ky
October 11th 1865
To His Excellency
Thos. E. Bramlette
Governor of Kentucky
Sir!
I have the honor to request that you will grant me a commission empowering me to act as a Notary Public, in and for the county of Jefferson, State of Kentucky.
Concurring my qualifications and fitness for the commission, I beg respectfully to call your attention to the testimonials Endorsed hereon.

Very Respectfully
Your Obedient Servant
Henry Weindell

Send to
Post office drawer
No 285
Louisville Ky
Journal
Octbr 13/65
Gov.
We cheerfully endorse the application Made, with the hope, you will at once grant the request of a worthy Gentleman

Asst. Qr. Mr. Office
Louisville Ky
Oct 11th 1865
Henry Weindell has served during the past year, in my office, as Property Clerk.
Of my own knowledge he is competent in that capacity, and entirely trustworthy in every respect.
He also served in the Field, during the first two years of the Late Rebellion, with credit to himself and satisfaction to his superior officers.

New duties render it necessary that I should have to a Commissioned Notary in my office, and I trust, His Excellency, Thos. E. Bramlett, Gov. of Kentucky, may be pleased to grant to Mr. Weindell his petition.

J F Belcher
Capt & A Q M

Notary Public
Jefferson County
Henry Weindell
comd
17th Oct 1865
